contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=February 2007}} {{Cyrillic alphabet navbox| Heading=Cyrillic letter Ka| Image=[[File:Cyrillic letter Ka - uppercase and lowercase.svg|120px]]| uuc=041A|ulc=043A|numeral=20}} '''Ka''' (К к; italics: <span style="font-family: times, 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: larger">''К к''</span>) is a letter of the [[Cyrillic script]]. It commonly represents the [[voiceless velar plosive]] {{IPA|/k/}}, like the pronunciation of ⟨k⟩ in "'''k'''ing". ==History== The Cyrillic letter Ka was derived from the [[Kappa (letter)|Greek letter Kappa]] (Κ κ). In the [[Early Cyrillic alphabet]] its name was {{Script|Cyrs|како}} (''kako''), meaning "as". In the [[Cyrillic numerals|Cyrillic numeral system]], Ka had a value of 20. ==Form== The Cyrillic letter Ka [[Homoglyph|looks very similar]], and corresponds to the [[K|Latin letter K]] but, as with most Cyrillic letters, the lowercase form is simply a smaller version of the uppercase. Cyrillic Ka is generally differentiated from its Latin and Greek counterparts by drawing its diagonal spurs with curves instead of straight lines. ==Usage== In [[Russian language|Russian]], the letter Ka represents the plain [[voiceless velar plosive]] {{IPA|/k/}} or the palatalized one {{IPA|/kʲ/}}; for example, the word ''короткий'' (''"short"'') contains both the kinds: [kɐˈrotkʲɪj]. The palatalized variant is pronounced when the following letter in the word is ''[[ь]]'', ''[[е]]'', ''[[ё]]'', ''[[и]]'', ''[[ю]]'', or ''[[я]]''. In [[Macedonian language|Macedonian]] it always represents the sound /k/. ==Related letters and other similar characters== *Κ κ/ϰ : [[Κ|Greek letter Kappa]] *K k : [[K|Latin letter K]] ==Computing codes== {{charmap |041A|name1=Cyrillic Capital Letter Ka |043A|name2=Cyrillic Small Letter Ka |map1=[[KOI8-R]] and [[KOI8-U]] |map1char1=EB |map1char2=CB |map2=[[Code page 855]] |map2char1=C7 |map2char2=C6 |map3=[[Code page 866]] |map3char1=8A |map3char2=AA |map4=[[Windows-1251]] |map4char1=CA |map4char2=EA |map5=[[ISO-8859-5]] |map5char1=BA |map5char2=DA |map6=[[Macintosh Cyrillic encoding|Macintosh Cyrillic]] |map6char1=8A |map6char2=EA }} ==External links== *{{Wiktionary-inline|К}} *{{Wiktionary-inline|к}} {{Cyrillic-alphabet-stub}}
